REST.content: the pair (of shoes) might not come back to anyone: disappoint desire to reattribute surplus value > might have been made to “remain” there, defying the tribute

REST.content: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)

REST.content: what is a pair in this case? a catastrophic question [?], the other is the catastrophe [?], the other is kept at a distance

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro, a pairing-together in difference of opinion, l’énigme d’un ajustement complémentaire des deux côtés, one edge to the other (d’un bord à l’autre)

REST.content: marche almost same word as mark, margins, also Pas > necessity of walking, lowest degree, must subjective or underlying level of culture/institution: pair of shoes

REST.content: DS turns around points of ballerina, “la syntaxe du point et du pas” > each pair referring to some other, signifying too the operation of signifying

REST.content: diabolical 2 right shoes, 2 left—don’t make a pair, ça louche ou ça boîte (inquiétante, menaçante)
REST.linkedContent: diabolical 2 right shoes, 2 left—don’t make a pair, ça louche ou ça boîte (inquiétante, menaçante)

REST.content: what if, and Derrida sees it too, they’re 2 left shoes, a double that fudges (brouille) both “pair & identity” à la fois—paralyzes directionality, fait loucher vers le diable

REST.content: Derrida’s hypothesis: the unpaired can show parity w/ greater force, like the useless can show utility
REST.linkedContent: Derrida’s hypothesis: the unpaired can show parity w/ greater force, like the useless can show utility

REST.content: [re: Shapiro/Heidegger correspondence] reciprocal legitimation, effects of a common code, mutual desire for truth: the 2 parts of the pair (identity & difference, total identity in concept or formal semantics, difference and non-overlap in directionality of traits)

REST.content: if there is a pair > a contract is possible, can look for subject, can hope (symbol of the symbolon)

REST.content: pas works (marche) badly w/out a pair

REST.content: Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)

REST.content: pair: a doubling that is a narrowing (resserrant), plus strict, plus étroit
REST.linkedContent: pair: a doubling that is a narrowing (resserrant), plus strict, plus étroit

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use

REST.content: Derrida sees 5 ways a pair can be detached (won’t tell us yet) [does he tell us at the end of essay, in relation to various spectral effects?]

REST.content: pour aller, aller ensemble, ou aller-à > the 2 shoes must make a pair (aller à doesn’t mean se rendre à)

REST.content: the unpairing of the shoes, as soon as they’re no longer going anywhere [Derrida gives a spectrum of possible specterings]

REST.content: bet comes back to a comparing (un pari revient toujours à comparer)
REST.linkedContent: bet comes back to a comparing (un pari revient toujours à comparer)

REST.content: has to be a difference to permit it: but a pair is a fixed difference, fixed bet not a bet?, bet so as not to bet, plus de pari, pas de pari > bet on pair: limit absolute wager (pari)
REST.linkedContent: has to be a difference to permit it: but a pair is a fixed difference, fixed bet not a bet?, bet so as not to bet, plus de pari, pas de pari > bet on pair: limit absolute wager (pari)

REST.content: this fixed orientation toward difference presupposes difference, sublates it, concerns Kant’s whole transcendental aesthetic
REST.linkedContent: this fixed orientation toward difference presupposes difference, sublates it, concerns Kant’s whole transcendental aesthetic

REST.content: betting on the pair, plus/pas de pari, trap always works in interlace (la piège marche toujours dans l’entrelacs): soit qu’il fasse marcher, laisse marcher ou qu’il paralyse [p. 373 only the pair can go]

REST.content: avoir fait marcher la destin, provoked someone to make an impossible bet: Van Gogh’s coup, genius of his unevenness (son impair)
REST.linkedContent: avoir fait marcher la destin, provoked someone to make an impossible bet: Van Gogh’s coup, genius of his unevenness (son impair)

REST.content: bet on pair to limit absolute wager [cf. pp. 301-02 Derrida doesn’t limit absolute wager?], which limits & tightens itself (se resserre) to point of self-strangulation, tying itself so as not to absolve itself > the cunning twist (le retors) of le pari absolu: must never exclude disparate or absolute unneveness (l’impair)

REST.content: disparate: that which opens up fort: da of shoe size (pointure), possibility of dis-pairing, play of dis/appearing > double, Doppelgänger, not pair (unadaptable to walking [à la marche])

REST.content: the de-paired (le dépareillé), the disparate, helps us better to think the pair’s repair (à sa réparation), à panser (bandage), à bander là où le-la-les double(s) band- [cf. P p. 88]

REST.content: haunting which works (travaille) the unpaired (thus the pair) irreducible to all the mimetologism (I don’t say the mimesis)

EU.content: opposition right/left a conflict btwn several strategies of political mochlos [a wooden beam, bref ce sur quoi l’on s’appuie pour forcer et déplacer]: serious discourses have more to do w/ levers than w/ ends > specular walking on 2 feet, Van Gogh’s pair of shoes: a university will have to walk on 2 feet, left & right
